_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Omaha RMP Executive Summary



This Executive Summary briefly describes the following elements as prescribed by the EPA RMP regulations:



?    The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the facility.

?    The facility and the regulated substances handled.

?    The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps.

?    The five year accident history.

?    The emergency response program.

?    Planned changes to improve safety.



Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the facility



It is Nash Finch's Policy to operate its businesses in a safe, environmentally responsible manner which protects the natural environment and the health of its associates, our customers, and the communities where we operate. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local safety and environmental laws and regulations. 



In response to this Policy, Nash Finch ensures that adequate resources and technology are provided to prevent the accidental release of ammonia from its distribution centers. All associates are trained regarding the hazards of ammonia during their initial orientation training session. Maintenance and other personnel receive specialized training regarding the hazards of ammonia and the operation of the refrigeration system.



Facility and the regulated substance handled



Nash Finch Company operates a food distribution center at 4228 south 72nd Street in Omaha Nebraska. The facility receives and stores grocery product for eventual distribution to Nash Finch and independent grocery stores in the Omaha area and throughout Nebraska and Western Iowa. Grocery products include dry goods, frozen products as well as meat and other perishable items. As part of this operation, perishable and frozen food storage areas are cooled using a refrigeration system containing anhydrous ammonia (the regulated substance). Ammonia is a particularly good refrigerant in that it is a naturally occurring compound,

it has superior thermodynamic characteristics and uses less energy over other refrigerants, and it has ozone depletion and global warming potentials of zero.



Accident release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps   



The basic elements of the Program 3 Prevention Program specific to the Omaha facility have been developed and implemented. This includes all of the parts present in the Process Safety Management Plan which has been reviewed and updated as of November 2013. This PSM Program provides operator'/mechanic training and incorporates the use of qualified outside contractors to ensure that the refrigeration systems mechanical integrity is maintained throughout the life of the process. 



Five Year Accident History



This section is not applicable since there have been no reportable incidents within the last five years. The potential for future releases has been addressed through the development and implementation of the facility PSM Program.



Emergency Response Program



Emergency response is covered in Part 6 of the Process Safety Management Plan. The Nash Finch Omaha facility has a detailed Emergency Response Plan that covers the specific hazards associated with the use of anhydrous ammonia in its refrigeration system. The purpose of the Plan is to provide the means for rapidly determining the appropriate response for any emergency that may develop as a result of an ammonia leak or release. This program is written, includes specific actions to be taken in response to an accidental release, includes procedures for informing local agencies responsible for responding to an accidental release and the public, and includes information for emergency health care.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Nash Finch Omaha incorporates changes resulting from the facility process hazard review, management of change procedures, compliance audits and incident reviews, where applicable, to help improve the overall safety related to the use and m

anagement of ammonia at the facility. The flexibility of the program allows Nash Finch Omaha to respond effectively to prevent or minimize any potential exposure to Omaha employees, the surrounding community and/or the environment. Specific actions taken to improve safety are the implementation of the facility PSM Plan and the Program 3 Prevention Program described in this Risk Management Plan as well as the associated administrative and computerized system controls for the refrigeration system.
